body: The underlying C API is safe to concurrent modification, so the Java iterator would be too without any additional machinery. Perhaps you have a concern I'm not catching on to, and if so, please do elaborate. (Is it that you're worried about concurrent use of the `Iterator` object itself, or concurrent modifications of the underlying graph?)
